title: Seeking menu close delay
content: Is there any way the user can set a short time delay on the closure of cascading menus? The default instant menu closure that happens when the mouse pointer strays a bit means that the user needs to be very slow and deliberate to be able to burrow down to the required folder (eg in Bookmark folders). This is a nightmare when burrowing down a couple of levels. Having the menu tree stay open until the drag 'n drop or menu item selection is complete is much faster and more user friendly.
creator: crossk

title: Tree structured folder lists in cell phone Thunderbird app?
content:
Desktop Thunderbird correctly displays Gmail's tags as an expandable tree structure. Cell phone Thunderbird does not.

I know that cell phone apps generally are less full-featured than desktop apps. Is that the case here? Or is there a setting in the cell phone app, which I have not found and which would correctly display the tree structure?
creator: dudleybrooks

creator: kerubino12

title: MacMini M4 - can't login to Firefox for Sync
content:
A few weeks ago I purchased a MacMini M4 and am unable to login to sync. MacOS and Firefox are up to date. When logging in to Firefox sync, I enter my email address and then password. I'm then prompted to enter the code sent to my email. I enter the code. I'm then prompted to enter the MFA code from my authentication app. I enter the code. An error shows up that says unable to process. I also deleted the Firefox app and the app data and reinstalled several times. I've tried logging in via Private Browsing. Nothing seems to work. I don't have any extensions installed or other applications or unnecessary processes running.

I have successfully logged into a MacBook Pro, a gaming PC desktop, an HP Windows 11 laptop, and a couple Linux devices and VMs...so I'm familiar with Firefox - been using it for forever. This is the only computer I can't seem to log into. Any suggestions for troubleshooting would be helpful. Thank you.
creator: _cFfoXS_

creator: smk092153

title: Not a question but a statement of disappointment
content:
Last week, I downloaded Firefox to try out and I liked it. My intention was to keep my personal browsing separate from my corporate browsing.

However, I was shocked to discover that my Microsoft Wallet in my corporate Microsoft Edge had been completely emptied! Puzzled and eager to regain access to my password-protected accounts, I remembered logging into LinkedIn via Firefox just moments earlier. Obviously, Firefox had my passwords. I used MS Wallet to import my passwords from Firefox, back to my Microsoft Wallet.

But how did all my passwords end up in Firefox in the first place? Even if I imported them, does that mean the MS Wallet needs to be wiped? I'm extremely disappointed in Firefox. This is terrible programming.
creator: kaushik.vyas
